noun.description: A temporary camp without tents or cover, used especially by soldiers or mountaineers.

verb.description: Stay in a temporary camp without cover.
examples: he'd bivouacked on the north side of the town
the battalion was now bivouacked in a field

origin: Early 18th century (denoting a night watch by the whole army): from French, probably from Swiss German Bîwacht additional guard at night, apparently denoting a citizens' patrol supporting the ordinary town watch.
